question: 1. Which one of the following steps is incorrect when performing DFS?

answers.a: STEP 1: Start by putting any one of the graph's vertices on top of a stack (acts as source node of DFS).
answers.b: STEP 2: Take the top item of the stack and set its visited as 1.
answers.c: STEP 3: Create a list of that vertex's adjacent nodes. Add the ones whose visited is 1 to the top of the stack.
answers.d: STEP 4: Keep repeating steps 2 and 3 until the stack is empty.

question: 2. What is the time complexity of DFS? V is the number of vertices & E is the number of edges

answers.a: BFS consumes more memory & DFS consumes less memory
answers.b: DFS goes deeper & deeper until the node has no children
answers.c: BFS involves traversing neighbors before other nodes

question: 4. Which one of the following are applications of DFS?
5. DFS can only be applied on Trees & not on Graphs.

answers.a: DFS uses exhaustive traversal along one path before exploring other options
answers.b: DFS can be used to find the shortest path between two nodes
answers.d: DFS can be used in topological sorting
